author: Christine Whitney
title: Spring Clean Your Closet: Top Strategies From Fashion Pros
text:
Step 1: Edit The most important phase of the spring closet makeover can prove torturous: deciding what to let go of. Clea Shearer, co-founder of the Home Edit, a Nashville, Tenn.-based organizing service, reinforces the old refrain: “The first rule of purging a closet is to physically touch each piece and check yourself—if you have not worn it in six months, the only reason it should remain in your closet is if you feel in the next six months you definitely will wear it.”
